Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery lekythos, with part of body; exterior: on shoulder, black-figure decoration consisting of foot race to right (naked youth with arms and top part of head missing); below, single line; on body, part of added red fillet of figure, to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Haspels, C. H. E., Attic Black Figured Lekythoi. Paris 1936, 33, attributes this sherd to the Taleides Painter, an artist first identified by Beazley.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 315-6, no. B337)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0804) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 97, pl. III, no. 27)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
